page.title: 16Kettlethorpe Poultry Farming
page.content: Commercially produced chickens provide jobs for thirty people in our area.Two managers oversee the fourteen sites, each staffed by two men.Day old chicks are brought to the housing units, each unit accomodating between 20,000/26,000 birds. For seven weeks the chicks are fattened up, on starter crumb for ten days, then on starter pellet,approximately eighteen tons per shed, and finally on grower for two weeks. The chickens are then sent to East Markham and Gainsborough poultry factories where they are killed and dressed for human consumption. As more chicken is eaten today than red meat it is thought that output can only increase. Animal Rights campaigners, known as "Friends of the Earth",pose a threat to the producers as it would be possible for them to damage the empty units during the changeover of birds.
